alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 9:05PM MST until January 05 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM WEDNESDAY TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, moderate snow. total snow accumulations 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northern sections of Laramie county until midnight. More snow will be develop across the entire area tomorrow. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 6 AM Wednesday to 11 AM MST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight MST tonight. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could also significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact commuters. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills
